chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery A. Turck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution and all applicable surcharges within the term of Extended Supervision. The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 25% of the Defendant's income.
Defender to pay costs and DNA surcharge withthin the term of Extended Supervision. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant to continue with drug treatment.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.    Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with Kellie Diels.

Defendant shall not go on the premises of Coyote Liquor, Beaver Dam, WI.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant is to maintain full time employment.

records.addlTxt: 01:30 PM. Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for defendant.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zachery A. Turck appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Victims rights compliance found.  W.B. called, S/T.  Recess for atty. to speak to defendant.  Recalled 2:02 pm.  Victim makes statement.  Atty. O'Connell heard on argument.  Atty. Klomberg is heard.  Atty. O'Connell heard on rebuttal.  Court is heard, motion to modify sentence is denied.

10:00 AM Defendant Zachery A. Turck appeared via zoom, in custody with attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This is a hearing to modify sentence.  Attorney Klomberg heard.  The victim was intending on personally appearing in court today, however due to a power outage yesterday is unable to appear.  Attorney Klomberg request an adjournment so that the victim may be present.  Attorney O'Connell takes no position.  Court grants and reschedules hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2021 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachery A. Turck in court, in custody with attorney Steven Howard Wright.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for Machner Hearing, court proceeding on defense's motion for ineffective counsel.   Atty Wright calls William Mayer, S/T.  Cross examination by Atty Klomber.  Atty Klomberg questions Attorney Mayer regarding  the pre-interview discussions they had.  Atty Klomberg request Atty Wright produce Atty Mayer's file.  Atty Wright states did not bring it to today's hearing.  Atty Klomberg objects.  Court takes recess.  Atty Klomberg will print the report.  Back on the record.  Atty Klomberg marked the Narrative Report as exhibit 5.  Witness reviews exhibit.  Atty Klomberg offers exhibits 1-6, court receives.  State moves exhibits 1-6 into evidence, court receives.  Atty Klomberg plays a portion of the CD marked as exhibit 1.  Witness excused.  Court closes evidence as to ineffective counsel claim.  Arguments by Atty Wright.  Arguments by Atty Klomberg.  Atty Wright gives rebuttal arguments.  Court heard;  court is not able to make findings that Atty Mayer's representation was deficient and that the result would be different.  Court denies motion to withdraw plea based on ineffective counsel.  Atty Wright heard on motion for sentence modification.  Counsel stipulate to 4 additional days jail credit.  Atty Wright withdraws portion of motion regarding state not producing documentation of the juvenile records.  Atty Wright is requesting sentence modified from consecutive to concurrent.  Arguments by counsel.  Court heard, will not modify sentence.  Atty Klomberg to draft order.

Defendant Zachery A. Turck in court with attorney Steven Howard Wright. Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Issue of release of juvenile records and attorney/client privilege waived for Machner hearing; State heard - no proper notice for issue on juvenile records, heard on same; State provides certified copies of records in 06JV104 to Atty. Wright; Court directs that originals of same provided by State be sealed; State requests that he wants Atty. Wright review records and if need be withdraw that portion of his motion; Court orders Atty. Wright to notify State by noon 4/1/16 whether that portion of motion is withdrawn; Court now hears motion for ineffective counsel to withdraw plea, whether atty./client privilege waived relative to plea; State argument; Atty. Wright argument; further discussion; State requests that Court set parameters on what Atty. Mayer is allowed to talk about, it is defense burden to show proof; Atty. Mayer heard on the issue - equal opportunity attorney and will talk to both defense and State; Atty. Wright wants to know whether Atty. Mayer wants to talk to both sides, not whether will do if ordered, State does not believe that is the issue to be decided; question is if the privilege is waived, then should be allowed to talk to both sides; Court requests from Atty. Wright to submit some type of case law on whether State can interview witness prior to hearing - to be done by end of next week; Hearing date will remain; State heard - wants time to be able to respond if need be; Court will move April hearing if need be

Sentencing hearing on March 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Zachery A. Turck in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prior to going on record, parties scheduled sentencing hearing. Court heard, finds victims rights compliance. Court heard regarding adjournment of sentencing hearing due to number of witnesses/testimony. This will be a plea hearing only. Sentencing hearing will be 3-20 beginning at 8:15 am. Court heard, reviews PQ&WOR, charges, rights and penalties. Def. pleads NC to Cts. 1 and 3.  Court heard, finds plea is made FV&I, finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds Def. guilty of Cts. 1 and 3. Remaining counts are DRI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
